item.title: Josette add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Josette add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Josette add a quote by Eve Ensler
item.description: "I finally know the difference between pleasing and loving, obeying and respecting. It has taken me so many years to be okay with being different, and with being this alive, this intense. (xxvi)" -- Eve Ensler

item.title: Josette add a quote by Kate Chopin
item.description: "Perhaps it is better to wake up after all, even to suffer, rather than to remain a dupe to illusions all one's life." -- Kate Chopin

item.title: Josette add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Let us read, and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world." -- Voltaire

item.title: Josette add a quote by W. H. Auden
Josette add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "We can judge our progress by the courage of our questions and the depth of our answers, our willingness to embrace what is true rather than what feels good." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Josette add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "[E]xceptional claims demand exceptional evidence." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Josette add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "To terrify children with the image of hell, to consider women an inferior creationâ€”is that good for the world?" -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Josette add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "I tried to believe that there is a God, who created each of us in His own image and likeness, loves us very much, and keeps a close eye on things. I really tried to believe that, but I gotta tell you, the longer you live, the more you look around, the more you realize, something is fucked up." -- George Carlin

item.title: Josette add a quote by Richard K. Morgan
item.description: "A preoccupation with the next world clearly shows an inability to cope credibly with this one." -- Richard K. Morgan

item.title: Josette add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "I noticed that all the prayers I used to offer to God, and all the prayers I now offer to Joe Pesci, are being answered at about the same fifty percent rate. Half the time I get what I want, half the time I don't...Same as the four-leaf clover and the horseshoe...same as the voodoo lady who tells you your fortune by squeezing the goat's testicles. It's all the same...so just pick your superstition, sit back, make a wish, and enjoy yourself..." -- George Carlin

item.title: Josette add a quote by Neal Stephenson
item.description: "Ninety-nine percent of everything that goes on in most Christian churches has nothing whatsoever to do with the actual religion. Intelligent people all notice this sooner or later, and they conclude that the entire one hundred percent is bullshit, which is why atheism is connected with being intelligent in people's minds." -- Neal Stephenson

item.title: Josette add a quote by Richard Pryor
item.description: "The reason people use a crucifix against vampires is because vampires are allergic to bullshit." -- Richard Pryor

item.title: Josette add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "I try to deny myself any illusions or delusions, and I think that this perhaps entitles me to try and deny the same to others, at least as long as they refuse to keep their fantasies to themselves." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Josette add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Words can be like X-rays if you use them properly -- theyâ€™ll go through anything. You read and youâ€™re pierced." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Josette add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "All that happens means something; nothing you do is ever insignificant." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Josette add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "If one's different, one's bound to be lonely." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Josette add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "One believes things because one has been conditioned to believe them." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Josette add a quote by Wally Lamb
item.description: "All the dead bolts, pulled shades and hidden knives in the world couldn't protect you from the truth." -- Wally Lamb

item.title: Josette add a quote by Neil deGrasse Tyson
item.description: "Ignorance is a virus. Once it starts spreading, it can only be cured by reason. For the sake of humanity, we must be that cure." -- Neil deGrasse Tyson

item.title: Josette add a quote by John Boyne
item.description: "There's things that happen in a person's life that are so scorched in the memory and burned into the heart that there's no forgetting them." -- John Boyne

item.title: Josette add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Josette add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "Perhaps watching someone you love suffer can teach you even more than suffering yourself can." -- Dodie Smith

item.title: Josette add a quote by John Connolly
item.description: "The nature of compassion isn't coming to terms with your own suffering and applying it to others: It's knowing that other folks around you suffer and, no matter what happens to you, no matter how lucky or unlucky you are, they keep suffering. And if you can do something about that, then you do it, and you do it without whining or waving your own fuckin' cross for the world to see. You do it because it's the right thing to do." -- John Connolly

item.title: Josette add a quote by Elder Thaddeus of Vitovnica
item.description: "Until you have suffered much in your heart, you cannot learn humility." -- Elder Thaddeus of Vitovnica

item.title: Josette add a quote by Arthur Golden
item.description: "Yet somehow the thing that startled me most, after a week or two had passed, was that I had in fact survived." -- Arthur Golden

item.title: Josette add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "Don't look forward to the day you stop suffering, because when it comes you'll know you're dead." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: Josette add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Injustice in the end produces independence." -- Voltaire

item.title: Josette add a quote by Fyodor Dostoyevsky
item.description: "Pain and suffering are always inevitable for a large intelligence and a deep heart." -- Fyodor Dostoyevsky
